intro: Koanophyllon mornicola, commonly known as the morning glory of the Sierra Nevada, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Convolvulaceae family, which includes many species of vines and herbs. The plant is characterized by its trumpet-shaped, showy flowers that typically bloom in the early morning. Its leaves are alternate, heart-shaped, and often covered in fine hairs. Koanophyllon mornicola is adapted to grow in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in mountainous regions.
